Posts.Content: Hello, my name is Maria. I'm writing in regards to my father, he is 75 years old. He had his enlarged prostate removed last fall after detecting cancer. His PSA stayed at 3 for 6 months and then went up to 4.3 and now currently at 4.7. His Urologist referred him to a Oncologist who preformed a CAT scan, Bone Scan, and other tests. The scans came back clear, they can not find any obvious cancer. Yet they are recommending hormone therapy and radiation of his pelvis. We aren't sure what to do. He's healthy, feels great...we hate to start radiation that will cause more harm than good since they have no real target. Do you guys have any suggestions? Is there anything else that we can do? Any help would be great as we're all quite stressed.
